title: Bug 7752: Export multiple files with same file name under different directories to zip file fails.
description:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Launch WSWB and create two projects.
2. Under each project, create a new file with the same name (such as "foo.txt").
3. From the main menu, select File > Export and select Zip File to export.
4. In the Export dialog window, select both projects created earlier, give the zip file a name (such as "test.zip"), and begin export to zip file.
OB: Exporting multiple files with the same name under different directories to a zip file fails. When selecting both projects in the Export dialog window and attempting to export to a zip file, an error message box pops up stating that problems were encountered during export. The details of the error message highlight the file of the same name in project2 as the problem.
EB: The export function should successfully create a zip file containing all the selected projects, even if they contain files with the same name but under different directories.
SR:
1. Launch WSWB.
2. Create two projects.
3. Under each project, create a new file with the same name (e.g., "foo.txt").
4. From the main menu, select File > Export.
5. Select Zip File as the export format.
6. In the Export dialog window, select both projects created earlier.
7. Give the zip file a name (e.g., "test.zip").
8. Click on the export button to start exporting to the zip file.
